privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.effectiveDate: This Privacy Policy is effective as of December 3, 2025.
privacy.intro: PushShare ('https://pushshare.app', hereinafter referred to as 'PushShare') establishes and discloses this Privacy Policy in accordance with Article 30 of the Personal Information Protection Act to protect the personal information of data subjects and to handle related complaints promptly and smoothly.

section1.title: Article 1 (Purpose of Processing Personal Information)
section1.intro: PushShare processes personal information for the following purposes. The personal information being processed is not used for purposes other than those stated below, and if the purpose of use changes, we will take necessary measures such as obtaining separate consent in accordance with Article 18 of the Personal Information Protection Act.
section1.items:
• Member Registration and Management
    • Purpose of identity verification and authentication for membership services
    • Identity verification for service use
  • Service Provision
    • Push notification delivery service
    • Cross-device push notification sharing service
    • Subscription service provision and management
  • Marketing and Advertising
    • Advertising service provision (Google AdMob)
  • Customer Inquiries and Complaint Handling
    • Response to and handling of customer inquiries

section2.title: Article 2 (Processing and Retention Period of Personal Information)
section2.intro1: ① PushShare processes and retains personal information within the period of retention and use of personal information under applicable laws or the period agreed upon when collecting personal information from the data subject.
section2.intro2: ② The processing and retention period for each type of personal information is as follows:
section2.items:
• Member Authentication Information
    • Retention Period: During the service use period
    • Basis for Retention: Necessary for service provision and contract performance
    • ※ Note: PushShare does not store users' email addresses in its own database. Email addresses are used only for Firebase Authentication and are managed by Firebase's authentication system.
  • Device Information
    • Retention Period: Until app deletion or upon user request
    • Basis for Retention: Device identification information for push notification delivery, which becomes meaningless when the app is deleted as it is no longer connected
  • Service Usage Information
    • Retention Period: During the service use period or upon user request
    • Basis for Retention: Necessary for service provision
  • Subscription Information
    • Retention Period: 5 years after subscription cancellation (retention of records related to contracts or subscription cancellations)
    • Basis for Retention: Legal obligation under relevant laws
section2.note:
※ Notice Regarding Account Deletion and Data Deletion
PushShare does not provide a separate account deletion function because we do not store personally identifiable information. The stored information is anonymous data that cannot identify specific individuals on its own, and remains as dummy data without a service provision purpose. However, if users request data deletion, we will delete the relevant data upon request via email (jj@dosusu.com).
section2.laws:
• Records on display/advertising: 6 months
  • Records on contracts or subscription cancellations: 5 years

section3.title: Article 3 (Items of Personal Information Processed)
section3.item1:
Member Authentication Information
  • Firebase Authentication unique ID (anonymous identifier, cannot directly identify individuals)
  • ※ Email addresses are used only for Firebase Authentication and are not stored in PushShare's database.
section3.item2:
Service Usage Information
  • Device information: Device name, model name, manufacturer, device unique ID
  • FCM token: Token for push notification delivery
  • User profile: Free push usage count, subscription information, daily push delivery count
  • App information: Package name and app name of selected apps
section3.item3:
Subscription Service Information
  • Subscription type, subscription expiration date, RevenueCat customer ID
section3.note: ※ The above information cannot identify specific individuals on its own. However, we collect only the minimum information necessary for service provision.
section3.items:
• Member Authentication Information
    • Firebase Authentication unique ID (anonymous identifier, cannot directly identify individuals)
    • ※ Email addresses are used only for Firebase Authentication and are not stored in PushShare's database.
  • Service Usage Information

    • FCM token: Token for push notification delivery

section4.title: Article 4 (Provision of Personal Information to Third Parties)
section4.intro1: ① PushShare does not provide personal information of data subjects to third parties in principle. However, exceptions are made in the following cases:
section4.item1: When the data subject has given prior consent
section4.item2: When required by law or when requested by investigative agencies in accordance with procedures and methods prescribed by law for investigative purposes
section4.intro2: ② Information is processed through the following service providers for service provision:
section4.item3:
Google Firebase
  • Firebase Authentication: Used for user authentication (email addresses are managed by Firebase)
  • Firebase Firestore: Used for user data storage
  • Firebase Cloud Messaging: Used for push notification delivery
section4.item4:
Google AdMob
  • Used for advertising service provision (advertising identifiers, etc.)
section4.items1:
• When the data subject has given prior consent
  • When required by law or when requested by investigative agencies in accordance with procedures and methods prescribed by law for investigative purposes
section4.items2:
• Google Firebase
    • Firebase Authentication: Used for user authentication (email addresses are managed by Firebase)
    • Firebase Firestore: Used for user data storage
    • Firebase Cloud Messaging: Used for push notification delivery
  • Google AdMob

section5.title: Article 5 (Entrustment of Personal Information Processing)
section5.intro1: ① PushShare entrusts personal information processing tasks as follows for service improvement:
section5.item1:
Google Firebase
  • Entrusted Tasks: Data storage and authentication services
  • Entrustment Period: During the service provision period
section5.item2:
RevenueCat
  • Entrusted Tasks: Subscription management services
  • Entrustment Period: During the subscription service provision period
section5.intro2: ② When entering into entrustment contracts, PushShare specifies in documents such as contracts matters related to prohibition of personal information processing for purposes other than the entrusted tasks, technical and administrative protection measures, restrictions on re-entrustment, management and supervision of trustees, and liability for damages in accordance with Article 26 of the Personal Information Protection Act, and supervises whether trustees safely process personal information.
section5.items:
• Google Firebase
    • Entrusted Tasks: Data storage and authentication services
    • Entrustment Period: During the service provision period
  • RevenueCat
    • Entrusted Tasks: Subscription management services
    • Entrustment Period: During the subscription service provision period

section6.title: Article 6 (Procedures and Methods for Destruction of Personal Information)
section6.intro1: ① PushShare destroys personal information without delay when it becomes unnecessary due to the expiration of the retention period or achievement of the processing purpose.
section6.intro2: ② Procedures and methods for destruction:
section6.item1:
Destruction Procedures
  • Select personal information for which destruction reasons have occurred and destroy it after obtaining approval from the personal information protection officer
section6.item2:
Destruction Methods
  • Electronic files are permanently deleted in an irrecoverable manner
  • Paper documents are shredded or incinerated
section6.items:
• Destruction Procedures
    • Select personal information for which destruction reasons have occurred and destroy it after obtaining approval from the personal information protection officer
  • Destruction Methods
    • Electronic files are permanently deleted in an irrecoverable manner
    • Paper documents are shredded or incinerated

section7.title: Article 7 (Rights and Obligations of Data Subjects and Legal Representatives and Methods of Exercise)
section7.intro1: ① Data subjects may request access, correction, deletion, or suspension of processing of their personal information from PushShare at any time.
section7.intro2: ② The exercise of the above rights can be made via email (jj@dosusu.com), and PushShare will take action without delay.
section7.intro3: ③ However, since PushShare does not store personally identifiable information, the stored data is anonymous dummy data. If users request deletion, we will verify identity through Firebase Authentication account information and delete all data associated with that user.
section7.intro4: ④ When exercising rights through a representative, a power of attorney must be submitted.
section7.intro5: ⑤ Requests for access and suspension of processing may be restricted under Article 35(4) and Article 37(2) of the law.
section7.intro6: ⑥ Requests for correction and deletion may be restricted when explicitly stated as collection targets in other laws.
section7.intro7: ⑦ Identity verification procedures are conducted when exercising rights to confirm whether the person is the data subject or a legitimate representative.

section8.title: Article 8 (Measures to Ensure Safety of Personal Information)
section8.intro: PushShare takes the following measures to ensure the safety of personal information:
section8.item1: Access Control: Restricting access to personal information to a minimum number of personnel
section8.item2: External access control through intrusion prevention systems
section8.item3: Encryption: Personal information is encrypted for storage and transmission
section8.items:
• Access Control: Restricting access to personal information to a minimum number of personnel
  • External access control through intrusion prevention systems
  • Encryption: Personal information is encrypted for storage and transmission
  • Regular security inspections and audits

section10.title: Article 10 (Personal Information Protection Officer)
section10.note: ※ Inquiries and complaints related to personal information protection can be made to the above email address.

section11.title: Article 11 (Department for Receiving and Processing Personal Information Access Requests)
section11.intro1: Personal information access requests are received and processed by the department below.
section11.intro2: PushShare will do its best to promptly process data subjects' access requests.

section12.title: Article 12 (Remedies for Infringement of Rights and Interests)
section12.intro: Data subjects can apply for dispute resolution or counseling related to personal information infringement through the following institutions:
section12.item1: Personal Information Dispute Mediation Committee: 1833-6972 / www.kopico.go.kr
section12.item2: Personal Information Infringement Report Center: 118 / privacy.kisa.or.kr
section12.intro2: In addition, administrative appeals can be filed when rights and interests are infringed due to the disposition or inaction of public institutions.
section12.item5: Central Administrative Appeals Commission: www.simpan.go.kr
section12.items:
• Personal Information Dispute Mediation Committee: 1833-6972 / www.kopico.go.kr
  • Personal Information Infringement Report Center: 118 / privacy.kisa.or.kr
  • Supreme Prosecutors' Office: 1301 / www.spo.go.kr
  • National Police Agency: 182 / ecrm.cyber.go.kr

section13.title: Article 13 (Changes to Privacy Policy)
section13.intro1: This Privacy Policy is effective as of December 3, 2025.
section13.intro2: If there are additions, deletions, or modifications to the content due to changes in laws, policies, or security technology, we will notify you through the website's notice at least 7 days before the implementation of the changes.
